006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.util;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonLocation;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonParser;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonToken;
011
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CustomCollectors;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
014
015import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
016import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
017import org.json.JSONObject;
018import org.json.JSONTokener;
019
020import java.io.IOException;
021import java.io.InputStream;
022import java.io.Reader;
023import java.net.URI;
024import java.util.Arrays;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.List;
027
028import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
029import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
030
031/**
032 * Provides utility functions to support reading and writing JSON, and for
033 * producing error and warning messages.
034 */
035public final class JsonUtil {
036  private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger(JsonUtil.class);
037
038  private JsonUtil() {
039    // disable construction
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Parse the input stream into a JSON object.
044   *
045   * @param is
046   *          the input stream to parse
047   * @return the JSON object
048   */
049  @NonNull
050  public static JSONObject toJsonObject(@NonNull InputStream is) {
051    return new JSONObject(new JSONTokener(is));
052  }
053
054  /**
055   * Parse the reader into a JSON object.
056   *
057   * @param reader
058   *          the reader to parse
059   * @return the JSON object
060   */
061  @NonNull
062  public static JSONObject toJsonObject(@NonNull Reader reader) {
063    return new JSONObject(new JSONTokener(reader));
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Generate an informational string describing the token at the current location
068   * of the provided {@code parser}.
069   *
070   * @param parser
071   *          the JSON parser
072   * @param resource
073   *          the resource being parsed
074   * @return the informational string
075   * @throws IOException
076   *           if an error occurred while getting the information from the parser
077   */
078  @SuppressWarnings("null")
079  @NonNull
080  public static String toString(
081      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
082      @NonNull URI resource) throws IOException {
083    return new StringBuilder(32)
084        .append(parser.currentToken().name())
085        .append(" '")
086        .append(parser.getText())
087        .append('\'')
088        .append(generateLocationMessage(parser, resource))
089        .toString();
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Generate an informational string describing the provided {@code location}.
094   *
095   * @param location
096   *          a JSON parser location
097   * @return the informational string
098   */
099  @SuppressWarnings("null")
100  @NonNull
101  public static String toString(@NonNull JsonLocation location) {
102    return new StringBuilder(8)
103        .append(location.getLineNr())
104        .append(':')
105        .append(location.getColumnNr())
106        .toString();
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Advance the parser to the next location matching the provided token.
111   *
112   * @param parser
113   *          the JSON parser
114   * @param resource
115   *          the resource being parsed
116   * @param token
117   *          the expected token
118   * @return the current token or {@code null} if no tokens remain in the stream
119   * @throws IOException
120   *           if an error occurred while parsing the JSON
121   */
122  @Nullable
123  public static JsonToken advanceTo(
124      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
125      @NonNull URI resource,
126      @NonNull JsonToken token) throws IOException {
127    JsonToken currentToken = null;
128    while (parser.hasCurrentToken() && !token.equals(currentToken = parser.currentToken())) {
129      currentToken = parser.nextToken();
130      if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
131        LOGGER.warn("skipping over: {}",
132            toString(parser, resource));
133      }
134    }
135    return currentToken;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Skip the next JSON value in the stream.
140   *
141   * @param parser
142   *          the JSON parser
143   * @param resource
144   *          the resource being parsed
145   * @return the current token or {@code null} if no tokens remain in the stream
146   * @throws IOException
147   *           if an error occurred while parsing the JSON
148   */
149  @SuppressWarnings({
150      "resource", // parser not owned
151      "PMD.CyclomaticComplexity" // acceptable
152  })
153  @Nullable
154  public static JsonToken skipNextValue(
155      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
156      @NonNull URI resource) throws IOException {
157
158    JsonToken currentToken = parser.currentToken();
159    // skip the field name
160    if (JsonToken.FIELD_NAME.equals(currentToken)) {
161      currentToken = parser.nextToken();
162    }
163
164    switch (currentToken) {
165    case START_ARRAY:
166    case START_OBJECT:
167      parser.skipChildren();
168      break;
169    case VALUE_FALSE:
170    case VALUE_NULL:
171    case VALUE_NUMBER_FLOAT:
172    case VALUE_NUMBER_INT:
173    case VALUE_STRING:
174    case VALUE_TRUE:
175      // do nothing
176      break;
177    default:
178      // error
179      String msg = String.format("Unhandled JsonToken %s.",
180          toString(parser, resource));
181      LOGGER.error(msg);
182      throw new UnsupportedOperationException(msg);
183    }
184
185    // advance past the value
186    return parser.nextToken();
187  }
188  //

190  // private static boolean checkEndOfValue(@NonNull JsonParser parser, @NonNull
191  // JsonToken startToken) {

200  // retval = JsonToken.END_ARRAY.equals(currentToken);
201  // break;

203  // case VALUE_FALSE:
204  // case VALUE_NULL:

206  // case VALUE_NUMBER_INT:
207  // case VALUE_STRING:
208  // case VALUE_TRUE:
209  // retval = true;
210  // break;
211  // default:
212  // retval = false;
213  // }
214  // return retval;
215  // }
216
217  /**
218   * Ensure that the current token is one of the provided tokens.
219   * <p>
220   * Note: This uses a Java assertion to support debugging in a whay that doesn't
221   * impact parser performance during production operation.
222   *
223   * @param parser
224   *          the JSON parser
225   * @param resource
226   *          the resource being parsed
227   * @param expectedTokens
228   *          the tokens for which one is expected to match against the current
229   *          token
230   */
231  public static void assertCurrent(
232      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
233      @NonNull URI resource,
234      @NonNull JsonToken... expectedTokens) {
235    JsonToken current = parser.currentToken();
236    assert Arrays.stream(expectedTokens)
237        .anyMatch(expected -> expected.equals(current)) : generateExpectedMessage(
238            parser,
239            resource,
240            expectedTokens,
241            parser.currentToken());
242  }
243
244  // public static void assertCurrentIsFieldValue(@NonNull JsonParser parser) {
245  // JsonToken token = parser.currentToken();
246  // assert token.isStructStart() || token.isScalarValue() : String.format(
247  // "Expected a START_OBJECT, START_ARRAY, or VALUE_xxx token, but found
248  // JsonToken '%s'%s.",
249  // token,
250  // generateLocationMessage(parser));
251  // }
252
253  /**
254   * Ensure that the current token is the one expected and then advance the token
255   * stream.
256   *
257   * @param parser
258   *          the JSON parser
259   * @param resource
260   *          the resource being parsed
261   * @param expectedToken
262   *          the expected token
263   * @return the next token
264   * @throws IOException
265   *           if an error occurred while reading the token stream
266   */
267  @Nullable
268  public static JsonToken assertAndAdvance(
269      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
270      @NonNull URI resource,
271      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken)
272      throws IOException {
273    JsonToken token = parser.currentToken();
274    assert expectedToken.equals(token) : generateExpectedMessage(
275        parser,
276        resource,
277        expectedToken,
278        token);
279    return parser.nextToken();
280  }
281
282  /**
283   * Advance the token stream, then ensure that the current token is the one
284   * expected.
285   *
286   * @param parser
287   *          the JSON parser
288   * @param resource
289   *          the resource being parsed
290   * @param expectedToken
291   *          the expected token
292   * @return the next token
293   * @throws IOException
294   *           if an error occurred while reading the token stream
295   */
296  @Nullable
297  public static JsonToken advanceAndAssert(
298      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
299      @NonNull URI resource,
300      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken)
301      throws IOException {
302    JsonToken token = parser.nextToken();
303    assert expectedToken.equals(token) : generateExpectedMessage(
304        parser,
305        resource,
306        expectedToken,
307        token);
308    return token;
309  }
310
311  /**
312   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed token.
313   *
314   * @param parser
315   *          the JSON parser
316   * @param resource
317   *          the resource being parsed
318   * @param expectedToken
319   *          the expected token
320   * @param actualToken
321   *          the actual token found
322   * @return the message string
323   */
324  @NonNull
325  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
326      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
327      @NonNull URI resource,
328      @NonNull JsonToken expectedToken,
329      JsonToken actualToken) {
330    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
331        String.format("Expected JsonToken '%s', but found JsonToken '%s'%s.",
332            expectedToken,
333            actualToken,
334            generateLocationMessage(parser, resource)));
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed set of
339   * tokens.
340   *
341   * @param parser
342   *          the JSON parser
343   * @param resource
344   *          the resource being parsed
345   * @param expectedTokens
346   *          the set of expected tokens, one of which was expected to match the
347   *          actual token
348   * @param actualToken
349   *          the actual token found
350   * @return the message string
351   */
352  @NonNull
353  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
354      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
355      @NonNull URI resource,
356      @NonNull JsonToken[] expectedTokens,
357      JsonToken actualToken) {
358    List<JsonToken> expectedTokensList = ObjectUtils.notNull(Arrays.asList(expectedTokens));
359    return generateExpectedMessage(parser, resource, expectedTokensList, actualToken);
360  }
361
362  /**
363   * Generate a message intended for error reporting based on a presumed set of
364   * tokens.
365   *
366   * @param parser
367   *          the JSON parser
368   * @param resource
369   *          the resource being parsed
370   * @param expectedTokens
371   *          the set of expected tokens, one of which was expected to match the
372   *          actual token
373   * @param actualToken
374   *          the actual token found
375   * @return the message string
376   */
377  @NonNull
378  private static String generateExpectedMessage(
379      @NonNull JsonParser parser,
380      @NonNull URI resource,
381      @NonNull Collection<JsonToken> expectedTokens,
382      JsonToken actualToken) {
383    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
384        String.format("Expected JsonToken(s) '%s', but found JsonToken '%s'%s.",
385            expectedTokens.stream().map(Enum::name).collect(CustomCollectors.joiningWithOxfordComma("or")),
386            actualToken,
387            generateLocationMessage(parser, resource)));
388  }
389
390  /**
391   * Generate a location string for the current location in the JSON token stream.
392   *
393   * @param parser
394   *          the JSON parser
395   * @param resource
396   *          the resource being parsed
397   * @return the location string
398   */
399  @NonNull
400  public static CharSequence generateLocationMessage(@NonNull JsonParser parser, @NonNull URI resource) {
401    JsonLocation location = parser.currentLocation();
402    return location == null
403        ? " in '" + resource.toString() + "'"
404        : generateLocationMessage(location, resource);
405  }
406
407  /**
408   * Generate a location string for the current location in the JSON token stream.
409   *
410   * @param location
411   *          a JSON token stream location
412   * @param resource
413   *          the resource being parsed
414   * @return the location string
415   */
416  @SuppressWarnings("null")
417  @NonNull
418  public static CharSequence generateLocationMessage(@NonNull JsonLocation location, @NonNull URI resource) {
419    return new StringBuilder()
420        .append(" in '")
421        .append(resource.toString())
422        .append("' at '")
423        .append(location.getLineNr())
424        .append(':')
425        .append(location.getColumnNr())
426        .append('\'');
427  }
428}
